title: MAG 167 - Curiosity Transcript-converted
text:
no 
thirst for revenge in the Archivist, only an eagerness to expunge an infection 
that had gone unnoticed for too long. 
And with that, Gertrude Robinson was without assistants. She never hired 
another. She worked with those that seemed useful until they were no longer 
so — Leitner. Dekker. Keay. Even Salesa on occasion. But she never again 
allowed herself to trust. 
(Beat) 
I, I, I'm sorry; I-I didn't, um— 
MARTIN 
Oh, no, it's, uh, it's okay. (cough) I just, I couldn't… not listen, or interrupt. Or— 
ARCHIVIST 
I, I, I promise, I, I didn't know I was going to do that. 
MARTIN 
I, I understand. 
(Sigh) Well, let's... try to avoid that next time. (little laugh) 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes, quite. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 167 – Curiosity 
17 
(Martin sighs through puffed cheeks) 
MARTIN 
So. What? Without assistants she'd be bad at the apocalypse? 
ARCHIVIST 
W-without trust. W-without a-a reason. 
Gertrude needed both the purpose her mission gave her and the control her 
position allowed. To be here, like us, without a, a reason, without someone to 
ground her? She-she'd have power, but, no control. No real purpose. 
Perhaps she'd d-dedicate herself to a-a d-doomed quest like us but… 
(Quieter) No. I think this would have broken her. And she'd have resigned 
herself to, ruling her domain. 
MARTIN 
What domain? 
ARCHIVIST 
We all have a domain here, Martin. The place that feeds us. 
MARTIN 
Oh. 
Where's yours? 
ARCHIVIST 
(Laugh) I mean we're… traveling towards it. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 167 – Curiosity 
18 
MARTIN 
Oh. Right, obviously. (small laugh) Duh. Um, what about me? 
ARCHIVIST 
(Cautiously) Would you, like me to— 
MARTIN 
(Quick) No, no. Don't tell me. I don't want to know. 
ARCHIVIST 
Okay. 
MARTIN 
(Coy) So. If you say Gertrude wouldn't have been able to go on without a 
reason— 
ARCHIVIST 
(Fondly conceding) Yes, Martin, you are my reason. 
MARTIN 
Just wanted to make you say it! 
(Beat) 
Cool. 
ARCHIVIST 
Right. Shall we press on? 
[Jangling zippers and gritty footsteps as they stand up] 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 167 – Curiosity 
19 
MARTIN 
Oh, ju-, uh, just, uh… before we do. 
ARCHIVIST 
Mm? 
MARTIN 
A moment ago, when you were talking. 
ARCHIVIST 
Right. 
MARTIN 
The old Archivist, Angus. 
(The Archivist inhales) 
You said Fiona was… 
(The Archivist sighs) 
…released when he died. 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes. 
MARTIN 
If you had died, would the others have been able to quit? 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 167 – Curiosity 
20 
I didn't know. 
MARTIN 
If you had, would you have told them? Would that have, have changed what 
happened? 
ARCHIVIST 
(Sigh) I don't know, Martin. I… 
I don't know. 
[They start walking] 
[Tape clicks off] 
[The Magnus Archives Theme – Outro] 
JONATHAN SIMS
